moves.1. c4: The English opening, a great move if you like a battle to happen early in the game. Personally, I prefer e4 or d4.
moves.1... e5: Normally, I would play c5, but recently, I lost many games with that. Instead, I choose to mix it up a little.
moves.2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 Nc6 4. c5: this move is much less useful then it looks.
moves.4... dxc5 5. Nxe5: after this it looks as if whit has the upper hand because if Nxe5 then dxe5 and material is even.
moves.5... cxd4: This move lets black win a pawn (and maybe more if white is careless).
moves.6. g3: I don't understand this move at all, it leaves his knight undefended, and a fianchettoed bishop doesn't do much when the opposite knight is already developed. Because of this, white loses a piece for a pawn.
